column4: no one answered in ubuntu-xgl. shouldn`t it be safe to run the official nvidia drivers with beryl on edgy now? my beryl-manager freezes xorg
well beryl is still not stable.
i see. the thing is, it worked perfectly with the nvidia beta drivers
I know there are issues with beryl and the latest release of the envy drivers.
how do I check what release I have? it just removed nvidia-glx with dist-upgrade, and installed a new nvidia driver after a "apt-get install nividia-glx"
and everything seems to work, apart from beryl-manager
6.10 is the version of hte distro you are running.
I meant what nvidia release. I guess envy was a typo?
oh you mena which version of nvidia
do you have hte current one from the repos?
if so you can apt-cache showpkg nvidia-glx
is there a way to check if my nvidia card works like it should?
like a 3d test or something?  What sort of issue are you having.
haven`t tested all that much, but my problem is that beryl-manager freezes my xorg
hrm.. yeah I would keep checking in #ubuntu-xgl
